intro: Calostigma baetaeanum, commonly known as the Baetian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue, often with a violet or purple throat. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or limestone habitats. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
